National Housing Fund (NHF) Deduction

nhf_deduction.Rd

nhf_deduction() Computes the NHF deduction from the basic salary using a default rate of 2.5% (0.025). The function ensures consistent computation by utilizing tax_exemption().

Usage

nhf_deduction(basic_salary, rate = 0.025)

Arguments

basic_salary

Numeric. The total basic salary earnings before deductions.

rate

Numeric or character. The NHF deduction rate (default is 2.5%, i.e., 0.025). Can be provided as:

  • A decimal proportion (e.g., 0.025 for 2.5%).

  • A whole number percentage (e.g., 2.5 for 2.5%).

  • A percentage string (e.g., "2.5%").

Value

A numeric value representing the NHF deduction amount.

Details

The National Housing Fund (NHF) deduction is a statutory contribution aimed at housing development. Employees contribute a fixed percentage of their gross emolument to support housing schemes. This function applies the standard NHF rate unless a custom rate is provided.

$$ \text{NHF Deduction} = \text{Gross Salary} \times \text{Rate} $$

See also

tax_exemption

Examples

# Default NHF deduction (2.5%)
nhf_deduction(2000000) # Returns 50000
#> [1] 50000

# Custom NHF deduction (3%)
nhf_deduction(2000000, 3)  # Returns 60000
#> [1] 6e+06
